div.head: AN EPIGRAMME IN praise of Virginitie.
div.l: CHast, pure, vnspotted, virgin beautie flies,
With sacred wings to the celestial skies:
Shee conquers nature, maisters flesh and blood,
A worke of worth; which rightly vnderstood,
Outvies the verie Angells; since that they
Haue no corporeal motiues: which do sway,
And leade desire: They without flesh surviue,
Which shee triumphāt doth from flesh deriue.
Her proper honour, and the glorie winne,
To haue beene chast, in spite of time and sinne.
Nature, youth, beautie, heat of blood, desire,
Fall all to short; if treason thy conspire,
Shee like a marble rock doth firmely stand,
And makes her conquest famous, hand to hand.
Victorious vertue doth more purely shine,
When earthly bodies equal those diuine.
